intro: Diplopterys microcarpa, commonly known as the Amazonian yoco, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain tiny, round seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforest canopies. Due to its unique properties, it has been studied for potential medicinal uses.
